revised_title: A New Method for the Quantitative Estimation of Hydrocyanic Acid in Vegetable and Animal Tissues
tldr: The author develops a new method for the quantitative estimation of hydrocyanic acid in vegetable and animal tissues. The method involves using picrate fluid and observing the evolution of hydrocyanic acid in response to different anaesthetics. This method can be used to estimate minute quantities of HCN, with potential applications in studying the relationship between chemical and electrical changes in living organisms.
